item.title: ‘Super speeder’ caught doing 88 mph on Ringling Causeway, police say
item.description: Police did not release the drivers’ name but noted it was 53 mph over the posted limit.

item.title: Tampa Bay Rays sale officially completed
item.description: According to the Major League Baseball (MLB) website, the sale of the Tampa Bay Rays has been completed.

item.description: She’s a senior and one of the captains for the varsity volleyball team.

item.title: Venice Fishing Pier fully reopens after several years of hurricane damage
item.description: The total cost for the reconstruction was more than $400,000.

item.title: How the government shutdown will affect student loans, FAFSA and the Education Department
item.description: The government shutdown means further disruption for the U.S. Education Department, which has seen half of its employees laid off by the Trump administration.

item.description: Multiple students reported feeling uncomfortable with his behavior.

item.title: Roller coaster death at Epic Universe spurs more complaints, lawyer says
item.description: More victims have reported injuries from a roller coaster at Epic Universe, according to the attorney representing the man who died after riding the coaster.
